Yes it does. T=
he possible difference being that in some cases you might be working with 3=
D space. If it's just a cnc drill, water jet, or laser machining=A0 then=A0=
 the salesman would probably do the job.
If it were a milling machine thing=
s would be more complex because they commonly travel the same path repeated=
ly....
Not a huge difference but a bit more to think about.
The RepRap proj=
ect, for instance, slices and dices the 3D model and then "prints" a layer =
at a time. (Lot's of repetition there)
http://www.reprap.org

If it's just a cnc drill, water jet, or laser machining  then  the salesman would probably do the job.<br>If it were a milling machine things would be more complex because they commonly travel the same path repeatedly....<br>Not a huge difference but a bit more to think about.<br>The RepRap project, for instance, slices and dices the 3D model and then "prints" a layer at a time. (Lot's of repetition there)<br>http://www.reprap.org<br><br> <br>--- On <b>Sat, 11/1/08, Colin Green <i><colin.green1@...></i></b> wrote:<br><blockquote style="border-left: 2px solid rgb(16, 16, 255); margin-left: 5px; padding-left: 5px;">From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...><br>Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Another use<br>To: neat@yahoogroups.com<br>Date: Saturday, November 1,
 2008, 5:36 PM<br><br><div id="yiv1070966752">





    <div id="ygrp-text">
            <p>Hi<br>
<br>
2008/11/1 kelly parker <<a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="mailto:bigblockfw%40yahoo.com">bigblockfw@yahoo. com</a>>:<br>
> Thinking a bit more along the same path (pun intended) would be G code<br>
> optimization.<br>
> I don't know if you've ever watched a cnc mill wander around waisting time<br>
> but it's expensive<br>
> if you're mass producing something like PCBs.<br>
<br>
This sounds similar to the travelling salesman problem - multiple<br>
points to visit and trying to minimize the overall distance travelled.<br>
So if the layout is already determined you're probably looking at well<br>
know algorithms for TSP (or TSP like problems). On the other hand the<br>
manufacturing cost of a PCB could be factored into the fitness<br>
function of a layout finding algorithm.<br>
<br>
Colin<br>
</p>

	</div></blockquote></td></tr></table><br>
